cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest through the southeastern and central Bahamas, then forecast to turn northwest toward the south Florida peninsula and Keys by late Saturday-Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida – near the Florida Keys / southwest Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Florida at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida (Miami-Dade & Broward counties), the Florida Keys, and southwest Florida coast up to Bonita Beach
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (70% probability) of sustained 50-kt winds and up to 47% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at PortMiami between late Saturday night and Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; water levels of 5–10 ft above ground possible along Miami-Dade shoreline if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals to 20 inches expected across southeast Florida, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, large breaking waves, and the potential for tornadoes in outer rainbands that could disrupt terminal and yard operations.
